 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our     
 deliberations to recognize the Honorable Kacie 
 Starr Triplett for her stellar accomplishments 
 and commitment to making our region a better   
 place to live and work. We direct the Clerk of 
 this Board to prepare a commemorative copy     
 of this resolution to the end that may be      
 presented to our honoree at the time and place 
 deemed appropriate by the sponsor.             
 Introduced on the 26th day of August, 2011     
 by:                                            
 HonorableApril Ford-Griffin,Alderwoman 5th Ward
           Resolution No. 191                   
          Dr. Doris Jones Wilson                
       WHEREAS, we have been apprised of        
 the retirement of Dr. Doris Jones Wilson, after
 having served the St. Louis community for      
 over 65 years in instruction, arrangement and  
 performance of music in every genre; and       
      WHEREAS, Dr. Wilson earned a              
Bachelor of Music Education Degree from               
Lincoln University in Jefferson City; a Master        
of Arts in Teaching and a Doctor of Education         
in Music Education from Washington                    
University.                                           
     WHEREAS, she is the former Professor             
of Music, Director of the Concert Chorale of          
Harris-Stowe State University and currently           
serves as Minister of Music for the West Side         
Missionary Baptist Church ;and                        
     WHEREAS, Dr. Wilson has been                     
recognized as an outstanding musician, teacher,       
and choral director and is known for a number         
of signature musical arrangements. In                 
September, 2010, the Kennedy Center                   
featured a special performance of one of her          
most popular arrangements: "Even Me."; and            
     WHEREAS, Dr. Wilson has received                 
many awards and commendations which                   
include: Living Legend Award of Ministers             
and Choir Directors, Hampton University,              
2004; Missouri Arts Award, Missouri Arts              
Council, 1998 Excellence in Teaching Award,           
Emerson Electric, 1997; Stellar Performer             
Award from the St. Louis American                     
Newspaper for outstanding in leadership in            
music education, 1994; Letter of                      
commendation from the Bahamas Department              
of Tourism for Concert Chorale Performance,           
1994; and Gold Medal for Concert Choral,              
International Music Festival, 1981.                   
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                             
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen for                 
the City of St. Louis that we pause in our            
deliberations to recognize the many                   
contributions and retirement of Dr. Doris Jones       
Wilson and direct the Clerk of this Board to          
prepare a commemorative copy of this                  
resolution to the end that it may be presented        
to our honorees at a time and place deemed            
appropriate by the sponsor.                           
Introduced on the 30th day of August, 2011            
by:                                                   
Honorable Terry Kennedy,Alderman 18th Ward            
Honorable Lewis E. Reed, President, Board ofAldermen  
           Resolution No. 192                         
            Bruce F. Fleming                          
      WHEREAS, Bruce F. Fleming, Chief                
Hospitality Officer for Big Brothers Big              
Sisters of Eastern Missouri enthusiastically          
works towards the mission to build trusting           
and enduring relationships that encourage and         
support young people and has provided 15              
years of outstanding service to the                   
organization; and                                     
     WHEREAS, Bruce F. Fleming was                    
recently inducted into the Henning's Circle           
Hall of Fame for his length of employment             
 and commitment to Big Brothers Big Sisters            
 of Eastern Missouri. He started his career as         
 the Development Associate, then served as             
 the Director of Special Events and is currently       
 the Agency's Chief Hospitality Officer where          
 he represents the face of BBBSEMO with                
 warmth and enthusiasm. ; and                          
       WHEREAS, He always goes the extra               
 mile to offer exceptional customer service and        
 truly represents the brand. Bruce was also            
 among the first of BBBSEMO employees to               
 become a Big; and                                     
       WHEREAS, Bruce F. Fleming has                   
 personally recruited over 50 teams and has            
 raised over $30,000 for Bowl for Kids Sake.           
 He has emceed over 32 bowling events and              
 has always served as Big Brothers Big Sisters         
 of Eastern Missouri's staff co-chair and              
 captain. Bruce is instrumental in guiding a           
 committee that helps organize BFKS events             
 and spreads BFKS goodwill to the St. Louis            
 community; and                                        
       WHEREAS, in an effort to continue to            
 give back to the community, Bruce F. Fleming          
 has served as the United Way, Employee                
 Campaign Coordinator at Big Brothers Big              
 Sisters for 12 years. He began as an agency           
 speaker in 1998 and still actively presents in        
 the St. Louis community about the need for            
 the United Way; and                                   
      WHEREAS, the City of St. Louis is                
 pleased and honored to recognize Bruce F.             
 Fleming for his dedication to the children of         
 our community and extends best wishes to              
 him for continued success, good health and            
 happiness as he continues his service.                
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                              
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of                  
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our            
 deliberations to recognize Bruce F. Fleming           
 and for his dedication to the children of our         
 community and extends best wishes to him              
 for continued success, good health and                
 happiness as he continues his service and we          
 further direct the Clerk of this Board to spread      
 a copy of this Resolution across the minutes          
 of these proceedings and to prepare a                 
 commemorative copy to the end that it may             
 be presented to our honorees at a time and            
 place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.              
 Introduced on the 30th day of August, 2011            
 by:                                                   
 Honorable Marlene Davis,Alderman 19th Ward            
 Honorable Lewis E. Reed, President, Board ofAldermen  
 Honorable Jeffrey L. Boyd,Alderman 22nd Ward          
 Honorable Joseph Vaccaro,Alderman 23rd Ward           
           Resolution No. 193                    
          St. Peter Claver Day                   
      WHEREAS, we have been apprised that        
 on September 11, 2011, the Knights and          
 Ladies of Peter Claver will celebrate St. Peter 
 Claver Day; and                                 
       WHEREAS, Peter Claver was a Jesuit        
 priest from Spain who devoted his life to the   
 men and women brought to the Americas from      
 West Africa as slaves in the early 1600s; and   
       WHEREAS, for more than forty years        
 Peter Claver dedicated himself to the ministry  
 of relieving the great suffering of the slave   
 population and proclaiming the value and        
 dignity of every person in the sight of God;    
 and                                             
       WHEREAS, the Knights and Ladies of        
 Peter Claver is a nationally recognized Catholic
 lay organization with more than 100,000         
 members throughout the United States who        
 are committed to the memory of St. Peter        
 Claver and continue his ministry through their  
 involvement in hundreds of community based      
 programs and activities; and                    
       WHEREAS, the Knights and Ladies of        
 Peter Claver is an exceptional organization     
 whose many efforts to promote education         
 civic involvement and spirituality in the City  
 of St. Louis are greatly appreciated;           
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                       
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of            
 the City of St. Louis, that we pause in our     
 deliberations to join with the Knights and      
 Ladies of Peter Claver in celebrating in St.    
 Peter Claver Day and we thank them for their    
 many contributions to the St. Louis             
 community and we further direct the Clerk of    
 this Board to spread a copy of this Resolution  
 across the minutes of these proceedings and     
 to prepare a commemorative for this             
 presentation to our honoree at a time and place 
 deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.              
 Introduced on the 2nd day of September, 2011    
 by:                                             
 HonorableAntonio D. FrenchAlderman 21st Ward    
           Resolution No. 194                    
         Jacqueline Sharp Scott                  
       WHEREAS, R.L. Jacqueline Sharp-           
 Scott a native St. Louisian and was educated    
 in the St Louis Public Schools and is a Sumner  
 High School graduate. She became employed       
 by Bi-State Development Agency, becoming        
 a bus driver when women began to become         
 involved in non traditional employment. Jackie  
 was employed until she had to retire because    
 of a life threatening illness. Being one to     
 exercise her faith, Jackie gives thanks to God  
 who brought her through many trials and         
tribulations to over come her illness; and        
       WHEREAS, seeking other avenues to          
enjoy life Jackie sought to become a member       
of the Prince Hall Masonic family because of      
its rich history as it related to Americans of    
African descent and because of the community,     
charitable works and social enjoyment. Jackie     
is indeed a working person and has excelled in    
every area of the Masonic family; and             
     WHEREAS, Sister Scott was initiated          
into Ladies of Mercy - Chapter #118- Order        
of the Eastern Star in 1994. She excelled to      
become worthy matron and founder's Day            
Queen in 1999. She has served under the           
leadership of past Grand worthy Matron            
Priscilla Harris as a Special District Deputy     
Grand Worthy Matron. She currently serves         
as her Chapter Treasurer; and                     
      WHEREAS, Heroine Scott is a past            
Most Ancient Matron Queen Victoria Court          
#9 Heroine of Jericho (2000). She is the past     
Secretary Queen Victoria Court # 9 Heroines       
of Jericho. She is a past Special District        
Deputy Grand Court Heroines of Jericho, and       
is a Past Queen Grand Court Heroines of           
Jericho; and                                      
      WHEREAS, Daughter Scott is a past           
Illustrious Commandress of Medinah Court          
#15 -Daughters of Isis (2008-2010). She           
serves Medinah Court on First Aide and            
Health, Creation Team (dragons), and the          
pronominal committee; and                         
      WHEREAS, R.L. Scott was initiated           
into Key Court #1 order of Cyrene in 1994.        
With continued commitment Jackie served as        
Royal Commandress from 1999-2001. R.L.            
Scott continues to serve as Court Secretary.      
R.L. Scott served the Most Royal Grand Court      
as Most Royal Grand General Secretary and         
as past Queen. Continuing to labor with the       
Grand Court, R.L. Scott currently serves as       
the Most Royal Grand Commandress of the           
Most Royal Grand Court-Order of Cyrene            
for Missouri and its jurisdiction having been     
elected in 2010 by the membership; and            
     WHEREAS, Jacqueline is the mother of         
two sons, Sidney and Robert Sharp,                
grandmother of five, and great grandmother of     
seven. She has two daughters-in-law, Faye         
Sharp and Doretha Sharp. She is a faithful        
member of Northern Missionary Baptist             
Church, under the leadership of Rev. Dr.          
Harold J. Butler. Her commitment to her           
church and her pastor is expressed in her duties  
as Secretary of First Aide and Health Unit,       
and Secretary of Pastors' support.                
     NOW THEREFORE BE IT                          
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of              
the City of St. Louis that we pause in our        
 deliberations to recognize the many              
 accomplishments of Jacqueline Sharp Scott        
 and we further direct the Clerk of this Board    
 to spread a copy of this Resolution across the   
 minutes of these proceedings and to prepare a    
 commemorative copy to the end that it may        
 be presented to our honorees at a time and       
 place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.         
 Introduced on the 16th day of September, 2011    
 by:                                              
 Honorable Charles QuincyTroupe,Alderman 1stWard  
           Resolution No. 195                     
             Dr. John A. Pieper                   
       WHEREAS, John A. Pieper, Pharm.D.,         
 FCCP, became the fourth president of St.         
 Louis College of Pharmacy on August 1, 2010.     
 During his first year at the College, he has     
 guided faculty, staff, students, and alumni in   
 creating a new strategic plan, STLCOP 20/20,     
 that will determine STLCOP's focus and           
 initiatives for the next decade. He has          
 challenged the College community to think        
 and act boldly, and has committed himself to     
 lead the way; and                                
       WHEREAS, prior to his appointment          
 at the College, Dr. Pieper served as professor   
 and dean of the College of Pharmacy at the       
 University of New Mexico, with concurrent        
 appointments as vice president for research      
 and deputy executive vice president at the       
 University of New Mexico Health Sciences         
 Center in Albuquerque. Dr. Pieper was also a     
 senior fellow at the Robert Wood Johnson         
 Center for Health Policy at UNM and was          
 adjunct professor, Facultad de Farmacia,         
 Universidad Autonoma del Estado de Morelos,      
 Cuernavaca, Mexico; and                          
       WHEREAS, prior to his appointment          
 at University of New Mexico in November          
 2002, Dr. Pieper served as professor and         
 chairman of the division of pharmacotherapy,     
 School of Pharmacy at the University of          
 North Carolina at Chapel Hill and as associate   
 dean for clinical programs and founding chair    
 of the department of pharmacy practice at        
 the School of Pharmacy, University of            
 Colorado. He has also held faculty positions     
 in the colleges of pharmacy at the University    
 of Tennessee and at the University of Florida;   
 and                                              
      WHEREAS, Dr. Pieper received a              
 bachelor's degree in molecular biology from      
 the University of Colorado, a bachelor's degree  
 in pharmacy from the University of Wyoming       
 and a Doctor of Pharmacy degree and post-        
 doctoral fellowship training at the School of    
 Pharmacy, State University of New York at        
 Buffalo. Dr. Pieper is a past president of the   
 American College of Clinical Pharmacy            
 (ACCP), a fellow of ACCP and has been a        
 board-certified pharmacotherapy specialist     
 with added qualifications in cardiology. In    
 2006, he was selected by the American          
 Pharmacists Association Academy of Student     
 Pharmacists for the Outstanding Dean Award     
 among pharmacy deans in the United States.     
 In 2008, he was elected Speaker of the House   
 of Delegates of the American Association of    
 Colleges of Pharmacy, and he serves as a       
 member of the Pharmacy Education Advisory      
 Committee for the National Association of      
 Chain Drug Stores. Dr. Pieper has just finished
 a four-year term on the American Society of    
 Health System Pharmacists' Commission on       
 Credentialing, which accredits first- and      
 second-year pharmacy residency programs in     
 the United States. In 2010, he was selected as 
 a Fellow by the American Pharmacists           
 Association; and                               
      WHEREAS, Dr. Pieper has trained 15        
 post-doctoral fellows and has over 80 peer-    
 reviewed research publications and             
 approximately 100 published research           
 abstracts in the areas of cardiovascular       
 pharmacotherapy, pharmacokinetics, and drug    
 metabolism; and                                
      WHEREAS, currently, he serves on the      
 board of directors for the United Way of       
 Greater St. Louis, the Urban League of         
 Metropolitan St. Louis, and the Goldfarb       
 School of Nursing at Barnes-Jewish College.    
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                       
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of           
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our     
 deliberation to recognize the many             
 achievements of Dr. John A. Pieper,            
 Pharm.D., FCCP and we further direct the       
 Clerk of this Board to spread a                
 commemorative copy to the end that it may      
 be presented to our honoree at a time and      
 place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.       
 Introduced on the 16th day of September, 2011  
 by:                                            
 Honorable Joseph Roddy,Alderman 17th Ward      
           Resolution No. 196                   
            Anthony Gandolfo                    
       WHEREAS, Anthony Gandolfo was            
 born in Campobello di Mazara, Province of      
 Trapani, Sicily on October 28, 1940. He        
 arrived in the United States of America on     
 board the Christopher Columbus in November     
 1958; and                                      
      WHEREAS, Anthony married Marisa           
 Teresa Indelicato on September 6, 1962. He     
 has two children, Giuseppe S. Gandolfo and     
 Josephine L.Gandolfo-Sabaski, and two          
 grandchildren, Emma M.Gandolfo and             
 Anthony M.Gandolfo; and                        
     WHEREAS, Anthony was the manager            
of the model/pre production department of        
Coin Acceptors. He is the owner of Gandolfo      
properties and co-owned Fifth Avenue             
Fashions with his wife, Marisa; and              
      WHEREAS, Anthony is a member of            
the Italian Club of St. Louis, serving 10 years  
as corresponding secretary. He is a member of    
the Sicilian Cultural Association of St. Louis   
and served as president from 1998-2000. He       
is currently the treasurer of the St. Louis      
Metro Chapter of UNICO. He is also a             
member of the Cheltenham Lions Club, the         
St. Louis Lodge #1-A.F.A.M and a member          
of the Columbus Day Corporation and co           
founded the Miss Columbus Beauty Contest;        
and                                              
      WHEREAS, Christopher Columbus              
was responsible for discovering the Americas.    
Italian Americans are proud that one of their    
own made this monumental discovery. Italian      
Americans come together every year to            
celebrate this discovery and the achievements    
of Italian Americans in the United States. ;     
and                                              
    WHEREAS, Anthony will be the Grand           
Marshall of the 144th Columbus Day parade        
on October 9, 2011.                              
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                        
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of             
the City of St. Louis that we pause in our       
deliberations to recognize the many              
achievements and contributions of Anthony        
Gandolfo and we further direct the Clerk of      
this Board to spread a copy of this Resolution   
across the minutes of these proceedings and      
to prepare a commemorative copy to the end       
that it may be presented to our honoree at a     
time and place deemed appropriate by the         
Sponsor.                                         
Introduced on the 16th day of September, 2011    
by:                                              
Honorable Joseph Vaccaro,Alderman 23rd Ward      
          Resolution No. 197                     
            George A. Stark                      
      WHEREAS, George has a remarkable           
history of community service and volunteer       
work. He has dedicated himself to various        
organizations for the last fifty years; and      
     WHEREAS, a number of his most               
notable community work began as the              
Coordinating Advisor for Junior Achievement      
which he served for 25 years. He was             
President of the Junior Chamber of Commerce      
for 2 years. He served as Chairman of the        
National Bureau for Fingerprint the Children     
and five years as Chairman for the Lupus         
Foundation Walk-a-thon and as Chairman for       
 the March of Dimes Walk America. He was            
 on the Board of Directors for the St. Louis        
 County Special School District Foundation          
 for 10 years; and                                  
       WHEREAS, George volunteered as the           
 photographer for the St. Louis County Girl         
 Scouts and as the photography instructor for       
 the handicap in the Ladue School District. He      
 participated in the BornAmerica National           
 Telethon and in the Muscular Dystrophy             
 National Telethon; and                             
       WHEREAS, George served on the Board          
 of Directors for UNICO from 1993 until 2011        
 and treasurer from 1993 until 2011. He served      
 on the Board of Directors for the Sicilian         
 Cultural Association from 1994 until 2001 and      
 as the treasurer from 1996 until 2001; and         
      WHEREAS, his numerous awards                  
 include the United Way Volunteer of the Year       
 Award for over 10,000 hours of volunteering        
 from 1972-1987, the American Institute of          
 Aeronautics and Astronautics Civil Service         
 Award for 25 years of community service. He        
 received the Special School District               
 Ambassador Award, which is the school              
 district's highest honor awarded to an             
 individual; and                                    
       WHEREAS, George will be awarded the          
 Spirit of Columbus Award by the St. Louis          
 Columbus Day Corporation at a presentation         
 on Saturday September 25, 2011.                    
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                          
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of               
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our         
 deliberations to recognize the many                
 achievements and contributions of George A.        
 Stark and we further direct the Clerk of this      
 Board to spread a copy of this Resolution          
 across the minutes of these proceedings and        
 to prepare a commemorative copy to the end         
 that it may be presented to our honoree at a       
 time and place deemed appropriate by the           
 Sponsor.                                           
 Introduced on the 16th day of September, 2011      
 by:                                                
 Honorable Joseph Vaccaro,Alderman 23rd Ward        
            Resolution No. 198                      
                  "Heat's On"                       
      WHEREAS, "Heat's On" is a program             
 with Local 562 and the Mechanical Contractors      
 Association of Eastern MO (MCA), is                
 celebrating its 25th year in 2011. Five different  
 agencies assist with locating those in need (St.   
 Louis County Human Services, St. Louis City        
 Agency on Aging, Energy Care, Home                 
 Services, and St. Joachim and Ann); and            
     WHEREAS, it is a program that was              
 developed to assist the elderly and                
 handicapped home owners who were not able       
 to afford to have their furnaces checked, along 
 with water heater, smoke alarms and many        
 other safety items. It was designed to make     
 sure the homeowners have heat for the           
 upcoming winter months; and                     
       WHEREAS, each year on one Saturday        
 in October, Plumbers & Pipefitters Local 562,   
 along with MCA team up to donate their time     
 and services to make sure that over 300 homes   
 are serviced on that day. Material and parts    
 are donated by local supply houses, breakfast   
 and lunch are usually donated by local          
 businesses, contractors donate the use of       
 service vans and tools, and the 562 members     
 donate all the labor. It is truly a community   
 effort; and                                     
       WHEREAS, each home has a 34 point         
 inspection including a thorough heating system  
 check to see that it is working properly and    
 safely. The service technicians also check to   
 see that other areas of the home have any       
 visible problems and are reported to city and   
 county agencies that will then have a follow-   
 up at a later date.; and                        
      WHEREAS, over the last 25 years Local      
 562 and their contractors have donated the      
 following: Number of Homes Serviced             
 (10,910), Trucks (2,786), Volunteers (7,509),   
 Man Hours (60,120) and Estimated Total          
 Cost ($6,012,000.00); and                       
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                       
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of            
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our      
 deliberations to recognize the success and      
 contributions of "Heat's On" and we further     
 direct the Clerk of this Board to spread a copy 
 of this Resolution across the minutes of these  
 proceedings and to prepare a commemorative      
 copy to the end that it may be presented to     
 our honorees at a time and place deemed         
 appropriate by the Sponsor.                     
 Introduced on the 16th day of September, 2011   
 by:                                             
 Honorable Joseph Vaccaro,Alderman 23rd Ward     
           Resolution No. 201                    
                 KiKu Obata                      
       WHEREAS, in 1977 KiKu Obata               
 founded Kiku Obata & Company a certified        
 minority and woman owned corporation that       
 has over the last three decades represented St. 
 Louis across the nation as a firm dedicated to  
 excellence in architecture, interior design, and
 retail development; and                         
       WHEREAS, Ms. Obata, as President          
 and Creative Director, has been a leading force 
 in the rebirth and revitalization of St. Louis, 
 having made significant contributions to the    
expansion of the Delmar Loop into the City       
of St. Louis and as a consequence, bringing      
new life and hope to a less populated and        
commercially abandon section of our city; and    
     WHEREAS, when Ms. Obata could               
have re-located her corporation and over 25      
employees to numerous cities across the          
country, she chose to remain in St. Louis, and   
to expand her business, providing additional     
revenue and jobs for our city; and               
      WHEREAS, Ms. Obata's corporate             
headquarters, designed to world class            
standards, is located above the Pageant Theater  
and now serves as an anchor in a commercial      
district once ignored by capital investment,     
and in effect, her decision ignited commerce     
were once there was none; and                    
     WHEREAS, Ms. Obata can be credited          
with contributions to the expansion, rebirth,    
and revitalization of organizations and          
destinations that are a part of the very fabric  
of St. Louis, the St. Louis Cardinals, the       
Washington Avenue Loft District, Washington      
University and many others; and                  
       WHEREAS, Ms. Obata has shown time         
and again her commitment to the betterment       
of St. Louis whether working to create a bridge  
between the city and county in terms of          
economic development with the re-branding        
of a historical district, or her major           
contributions to the arts through her dynamic    
leadership on the board of the St. Louis         
Shakespeare Festival.                            
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                        
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of             
the City of St. Louis that we pause in our       
deliberations to congratulate KiKu Obata and     
the staff of KiKu Obata and Company for          
being shining examples of what hard work and     
determination can accomplish, in a city "that    
works" and we further direct the Clerk of this   
Board to spread a copy of this Resolution        
across the minutes of these proceedings and      
to further prepare a commemorative copy to       
the end that it may be presented to our honoree  
at a time and place deemed appropriate by        
the Sponsor.                                     
Introduced on the 16th day of September, 2011    
by:                                              
Honorable Lyda Krewson,Alderwoman 28th Ward      
     Unanimous consent having been               
obtained Resolutions No. 145 through 198         
and 201 stood considered.                        
      President Reed moved that Resolutions      
No. 145 through 198 and 201 be adopted, at       
this meeting of the Board.                       
     Seconded by Mr. Boyd.                       
      Carried unanimously by voice vote.          
           FIRST READING OF                       
             RESOLUTIONS                          
      Ms. Ford-Griffin introduced Resolution      
 No. 199 and the Clerk was instructed to read     
 same.                                            
           Resolution No. 199                     
     WILSHER GOODFELLOW LLC.                      
     at 1807 Glasgow Avenue and                   
          2830 Magazine Avenue                    
           in the City of St. Louis               
       Enhanced Enterprise Zone                   
       WHEREAS, by Ordinance No. 67350            
 this St. Louis Board of Aldermen (the "Board")   
 authorized the Mayor, on behalf of the City      
 of St. Louis (the "City"), to request the        
 designation of a certain area of the City, as    
 more fully described in said ordinance           
 approved December 11, 2006 as an Enhanced        
 Enterprise Zone ("EEZ") eligible for the tax     
 incentives provided in Sections 135.950          
 through 135.973, inclusive, R.S.MO. (2000)       
 as amended (the "Statute"); and                  
       WHEREAS, the Statute allows, in            
 certain circumstances and subject to certain     
 conditions, the ad valorem taxes which would     
 otherwise be due on subsequent real estate       
 improvements made in EEZ areas to be abated      
 up to 100% for a period not to exceed 25         
 years from the date the original EEZ Area was    
 so designated, or until December 11, 2031;       
 and                                              
      WHEREAS, Ordinance No. 67350                
 provides for a ten (10) year abatement of taxes  
 on real property in the EEZ in accordance        
 with the requirements of Section 135.963 of      
 the Statute, as amended from time to time,       
 subject to certain terms and conditions; and     
       WHEREAS, Ordinance No. 67350               
 provides for the Enhanced Enterprise Zone        
 Board (the "EEZ Board") to review plans for      
 subsequent improvements on real property         
 in the EEZ (the "Subsequent Improvements")       
 and to recommend to this Board the extent to     
 which tax abatement should be granted            
 therefor; and                                    
      WHEREAS, Wilsher Goodfellow                 
 LLC. ("Developer") is rehabilitating property    
 located at 1807 Glasgow Ave. and 2830            
 Magazine St.; resulting in Subsequent            
 Improvements; and                                
      WHEREAS, it is estimated that the           
 Subsequent Improvements will cost                
 approximately $1.5 million; and will result in   
 approximately 20 new jobs; and                   
     WHEREAS, EEZ Board has reviewed              
 plans for Wilsher Goodfellow LLC                 
 Subsequent Improvements and recommends           
 that the ad valorem taxes that would otherwise   
 be imposed on Subsequent Improvements be         
 abated fully for a period of ten (10 ) years;    
 and                                              
     WHEREAS, "Developer") began the              
 Subsequent Improvements after January 11,        
 2007, the effective date of Ordinance No.        
 67350; and                                       
       WHEREAS, Section 135.963 of the            
 Statute provides that no abatement shall be      
 granted except upon approval of an               
 authorizing resolution by the governing          
 authority having jurisdiction over the           
 Enhanced Enterprise Zone area following a        
 public hearing held by said governing authority  
 for the purpose of obtaining the opinions and    
 suggestions of residents of political subdivision
 in the area affected and published in a          
 newspaper of general circulation in the area to  
 be affected by the exemption at least twenty     
 (20) days prior to the hearing but not more      
 than thirty (30) days prior to the hearing,      
 stating the time, location, date and purpose of  
 the hearing; and                                 
       WHEREAS, such public hearing was           
 held on the 16th day of September, 2011,         
 notice of which was given in accordance with     
 the requirements of the Statutes as described    
 above, and all interested parties had the        
 opportunity to be heard at said public hearing.  
       NOW, THEREFORE, be it resolved by          
 the St. Louis Board of Aldermen as follows:      
      1. The Subsequent Improvements for          
         property at 1807 Glasgow Ave. and        
         2830 Magazine St. shall be fully         
         exempt from the ad valorem taxes,        
         which would otherwise be imposed         
         thereon, for a period of ten (10) years. 
      2. For purposes of calculating the tax      
         liability for the Subsequent             
         Improvements, any increase in the        
         assessment of any improvements,          
         from the assessment in effect for such   
         improvements as of January 1, 2010,      
         shall be deemed attributable to the      
         Subsequent Improvements.                 
      3. In accordance with Section 135.963.2     
         of the Statute, a copy of this resolution
         shall be forwarded to the Director of    
         Missouri Department of Economic          
         Development within thirty (30) days      
         of its approval.                         
 Introduced this 16th day of September, 2011      
 by:                                              
 HonorableApril Ford-Griffin,Alderman 5th Ward    
     Unanimous consent having been                
 obtained Resolution No. 199 stood                
considered.                                      
    Ms. Ford-Griffin moved that Resolution       
No. 199 be referred to the Committee on          
Housing, Urban Development and Zoning.           
     Seconded by Ms. Florida.                    
     Carried unanimously by voice vote.          
     Ms. Triplett introduced Resolution No.      
200 and the Clerk was instructed to read same.   
          Resolution No. 200                     
  BEAUMONT ACQUISITIONS, LLC,                    
           2720 Market, in the                   
              City of St. Louis                  
      Enhanced Enterprise Zone                   
      WHEREAS, by Ordinance No. 67350            
this St. Louis Board of Aldermen (the "Board")   
authorized the Mayor, on behalf of the City      
of St. Louis (the "City"), to request the        
designation of a certain area of the City, as    
more fully described in said ordinance           
approved December 11, 2006 as an Enhanced        
Enterprise Zone ("EEZ") eligible for the tax     
incentives provided in Sections 135.950          
through 135.973, inclusive, R.S.MO. (2000)       
as amended (the "Statute"); and                  
      WHEREAS, the Statute allows, in            
certain circumstances and subject to certain     
conditions, the ad valorem taxes which would     
otherwise be due on subsequent real estate       
improvements made in EEZ areas to be abated      
up to 100% for a period not to exceed 25         
years from the date the original EEZ Area was    
so designated, or until December 11, 2031;       
and                                              
     WHEREAS, Ordinance No. 67350                
provides for a ten (10) year abatement of taxes  
on real property in the EEZ in accordance        
with the requirements of Section 135.963 of      
the Statute, as amended from time to time,       
subject to certain terms and conditions; and     
      WHEREAS, Ordinance No. 67350               
provides for the Enhanced Enterprise Zone        
Board (the "EEZ Board") to review plans for      
subsequent improvements on real property         
in the EEZ (the "Subsequent Improvements")       
and to recommend to this Board the extent to     
which tax abatement should be granted            
therefor; and                                    
     WHEREAS, Beaumont Acquisitions,             
LLC ("Developer") is rehabilitating property     
located at 2720 Market Street; resulting in      
Subsequent Improvements; and                     
     WHEREAS, it is estimated that the           
Subsequent Improvements will cost                
approximately $250,000; and will result in 10    
new jobs over five (5) years; and                
     WHEREAS, EEZ Board has reviewed             
plans for Beaumont Acquisitions, LLC             
 Subsequent Improvements and recommends             
 that the ad valorem taxes that would otherwise     
 be imposed on Subsequent Improvements be           
 abated fully for a period of ten (10 ) years;      
 and                                                
     WHEREAS, "Developer") began the                
 Subsequent Improvements after January 11,          
 2007, the effective date of Ordinance No.          
 67350; and                                         
       WHEREAS, Section 135.963 of the              
 Statute provides that no abatement shall be        
 granted except upon approval of an                 
 authorizing resolution by the governing            
 authority having jurisdiction over the             
 Enhanced Enterprise Zone area following a          
 public hearing held by said governing authority    
 for the purpose of obtaining the opinions and      
 suggestions of residents of political subdivision  
 in the area affected and published in a            
 newspaper of general circulation in the area to    
 be affected by the exemption at least twenty       
 (20) days prior to the hearing but not more        
 than thirty (30) days prior to the hearing,        
 stating the time, location, date and purpose of    
 the hearing; and                                   
       WHEREAS, such public hearing was             
 held on the ______ day of ___________, 2011,       
 notice of which was given in accordance with       
 the requirements of the Statutes as described      
 above, and all interested parties had the          
 opportunity to be heard at said public hearing.    
       NOW, THEREFORE, be it resolved by            
 the St. Louis Board of Aldermen as follows:        
      1. The Subsequent Improvements for            
         property at 2720 Market Street shall       
         be fully exempt from the ad valorem        
         taxes, which would otherwise be            
         imposed thereon, for a period of ten       
         (10) years.                                
      2. For purposes of calculating the tax        
         liability for the Subsequent               
         Improvements, any increase in the          
         assessment of any improvements,            
         from the assessment in effect for such     
         improvements as of January 1, 2010,        
         shall be deemed attributable to the        
         Subsequent Improvements.                   
      3. In accordance with Section 135.963.2       
         of the Statute, a copy of this resolution  
         shall be forwarded to the Director of      
         Missouri Department of Economic            
         Development within thirty (30) days        
         of its approval.                           
 Introduced this 16th day of September, 2011        
 by:                                                
 Honorable Kacie StarrTriplett,Alderwoman 6thWard   
      Unanimous consent having been                 
 obtained Resolution No. 200 stood            
 considered.                                  
      Ms. Triplett moved that Resolution No.  
 200 be referred to the Committee on Housing, 
 Urban Development and Zoning.                
      Seconded by Mr. Cohn.                   
      Carried unanimously by voice vote.      
        SECOND READING OF                     
           RESOLUTIONS                        
      None.                                   
       MISCELLANEOUS AND                      
       UNFINISHED BUSINESS                    
      None.                                   
           ANNOUNCEMENTS                      
      None.                                   
         EXCUSED ALDERMEN                     
      Mr. Wessels moved to excuse the         
 following aldermen due to their necessary    
 absence: Ms. Young, Mr. Arnowitz, Ms.        
 Baringer and Mr. Schmid.                     
      Seconded by Mr. Villa.                  
      Carried unanimously by voice vote.      
              ADJOURNMENT                     
       Mr. Wessels moved to adjourn under     
 rules to return September 23, 2011.          
      Seconded by Mr. Carter.                 
      Carried unanimously by voice vote.      
      Respectfully submitted,                 
      David W. Sweeney                        
      Clerk, Board of Aldermen                
   BOARD OF                                   
 PUBLIC SERVICE                               
          REGULAR MEETING                     
  St. Louis, MO - September 20, 2011          
      Board met at 1:45 P.M.                  
     Present: Directors Waelterman, Siedhoff, 
 Bryson and President Bradley.                
     Absent: Director Skouby, Bess and Rice-  
 Walker. (excused)                            
       Requests of the Directors of Public    
 Utilities, Parks, Recreation and Forestry and
 Health and Hospitals to be excused from the  
 Regular Meeting of September 20, 2011 was    
 read and leaves of absence granted.          
      Minutes of the Regular Meeting of       
 September 13, 2011 was unanimously           
 approved.                                    
      Communications, reports, recommenda-    
tions and documents were submitted by Board      
Members and action thereon taken as follows:     
                LETTINGS                         
      Four sealed proposals for the public       
work advertised under Letting No. 8487 - B-      
C Connector, Repair at Lambert-St. Louis         
International Airport (Storm Recovery Effort)    
and,                                             
      Four sealed proposals for the public       
work advertised under Letting No. 8490 -         
Concrete and Brick Removal/Replacement and       
Complete Sidewalk Installation, SP-86 was        
received, publicly opened, read and referred     
to the President.                                
               PRESIDENT                         
      Addendum No. 2 to the plans and            
specifications for Letting No. 8488 - America's  
Center Exhibition Hall Mechanical and            
Electrical Improvements approved and made        
part of the original plans.                      
     Addendum No. 3 to the plans and             
specifications for Letting No. 8489 - America's  
Center Ballroom Renovations, approved and        
made part of the original plans.                 
PRESIDENT AND DIRECTORS OF                       
 PUBLIC UTILITIES, STREETS                       
  AND PARKS, RECREATION                          
      AND FORESTRY                               
     Application No. 117648, Great River         
Greenway, to do public improvements at           
Skinker and Etzel through Porter Park to         
Delmar ordered approved, subject to certain      
conditions.                                      
DIRECTOR OF PUBLIC UTILITIES                     
      The Board declared as an emergency         
testing of three 16" water meters ordered        
approved.                                        
    DIRECTORS OF PUBLIC                          
 UTILITIES AND PUBLIC SAFETY                     
     3 Permits to consolidate land ordered       
approved, subject to certain conditions as       
follows: 117810, Cheryl Hall, 3665-67-69         
Finney in C.B. 117810, 117825, Imran             
Hanafi, 4464 R Maryland in C.B. 3899 and,        
117799, Hilario Vargas, 2953-55 Winnebago        
in C.B. 1635.                                    
      DIRECTOR OF STREETS                        
     Second Memorandum of Agreement              
between the City of St. Louis, Missouri and      
Bi-State Development Agency of the               
Missouri-Illinois Metropolitan District for the  
Agency's Riverboat's, Dock Barge and             
Heliport Operations on the City Improved         
Wharf ordered approved.                          
      4 Permits ordered approved, subject to     
certain conditions as follows: 117800, Lester's  
Tavern, encroach with sidewalk cafe (20 tables   
 and 56 chairs) with liquor at 4651 Maryland,     
 117784, Southtown Pub, encroach with fence       
 and sidewalk cafe (4 tables and 16 chairs) with  
 liquor at 3707 So. Kingshighway and, 117571,     
 Park Central Development, to encroach with       
 25, 2 affixed to existing cobra- head light      
 fixtures and 3 stand alone signs in the Forest   
 Park Southeast neighborhood. 117783, Tower       
 Grove Business Association, encroach with        
 10 trash receptacles along Morganford            
 between Arsenal on the north and Utah at         
 Fyler on the south.                              
   DIRECTORS OF STREETS AND                       
     HEALTH AND HOSPITALS                         
       Application No. 117826, Midtown            
 Alley Inc., hold event September 30-October      
 2, 2011 declaring the area of Locust from 150'   
 east of Garrison to the east curb of Josephine   
 Baker a festival zone ordered approved,          
 subject to certain conditions.

   RECREATION AND FORESTRY                        
   AND HEALTH AND HOSPITALS

 certain conditions as follows: 117718, DT2 -

 and Mayor's Vangard Council, hold event          
 October 23, 2011 at Marquette Park and,

 event October 2, 2011 at Carondelet Park.        
   DIRECTOR OF PUBLIC SAFETY                      
       6 Conditional Use Permits ordered          
 approved as submitted by the Hearing Officer,    
 per Board Order No. 766: 117828, 1035 So.        
 Vandeventer, office, warehouse, record boxes     
 and inside storage, 4715-17 Macklind, art        
 studio, gallery with art sales and classes,      
 117829, 3728 Minnesota. design company           
 (office use only) home occupancy wavier,         
 117831, 4507-09 Olive, adult day care 50         
 adults, Monday-Friday, 6 a.m. to 6 p.m., no      
 cooking, 117832, 711 So. Theresa, recycling      
 with outside storage of aluminum, HVAC           
 Mat., no junk cars, 117833, 3046-48 Watson,      
 warehouse, office, inside storage, plants and    
 planters, 117832, 2131 Marconi, sit-down,        
 carryout deli with smoker, no cooking, no        
 liquor.                                          
      Agenda Items for September 20, 2011         
 ordered approved.                                
      The Board adjourned to meet Tuesday,        
 September 27, 2011.

                 President                        
 ATTEST:                                          
                 Cherise D. Thomas                
                 Secretary                        
  PUBLIC NOTICE                                 
           Revised 9-12-11                      
      A public hearing will be held by the      
 Board of Adjustment at 1:30 p.m. on            
 Wednesday, October 5, 2011 in Room 208         
 City Hall to consider the following:           
      APPEAL #9839 - Appeal filed by            
 Curtain Roofing & Construction Company,        
 from the determination of the Building         
 Commissioner in the denial of an occupancy     
 permit authorizing the Appellant to have       
 outside storage of company trucks, equipment   
 and material at 5376 Rear Dr. Martin Luther    
 King Dr. WARD 26 #AO492477-11 ZONE:            
 "G" - Local Commercial & Office District       
      APPEAL #9840 - Appeal filed by JB         
 Walton Salvage, from the determination of the  
 Building Commissioner in the denial of an      
 occupancy permit authorizing the Appellant     
 to operate an office and salvage yard at 1601- 
 17 N. 13th Street. WARD 5 #AO491790-11         
 ZONE: "J" - Industrial District                
       APPEAL #9841 - Appeal filed by Stray     
 Rescue of St. Louis, from the determination    
 of the Building Commissioner in the denial of  
 an occupancy permit authorizing the            
 Appellant to operate an animal shelter at 1463 
 S. 18th Street. WARD 6 #AO491879-11            
 ZONE: "B" - Two Family Dwelling                
 District                                       
       APPEAL #9842 - Appeal filed by JB        
 Walton Salvage, from the determination of the  
 Building Commissioner in the denial of a       
 building permit authorizing the Appellant to   
 erect one non-illuminated wall sign, per plans,
 at 3903 Clarence. WARD 21 #AB492042-11         
 ZONE: "B" - Two Family Dwelling                
 District                                       
       APPEAL #9843 - Appeal filed by New       
 Bethlehem M B Church, from the                 
 determination of the Building Commissioner     
 in the denial of a building permit authorizing 
 the Appellant to construct a church at 1260    
 N. Euclid. WARD 18 #AB491320-11 ZONE:          
 "F" - Neighborhood Commercial District         
       APPEAL #9844 - Appeal filed by           
 Ronmar Contracting, from the determination     
 of the Building Commissioner in the denial of  
 a building permit authorizing the Appellant    
 to construct a carport, per plans, at 2816     
 Lemp. WARD 9 #AB491715-11 ZONE: "D"            
 - Multiple Family Dwelling District            
      In accordance with the provisions of      
 ordinance 59981, effective July 31, 1986.      
     By authority of the Board of               
 Adjustment.                                    
      S. Cunningham, Chairman                   
 PUBLIC NOTICE                                      
     A public hearing will be held by the           
Board of Adjustment at 1:30 p.m. on                 
Wednesday, October 12, 2011 in Room 208             
City Hall to consider the following:                
      APPEAL #9845 - Appeal filed by                
Razzle Dazzle Learning Center, from the             
determination of the Building Commissioner          
in the denial of an occupancy permit                
authorizing the Appellant to operate a daycare      
for 26 kids (8 infants and 18 kids 2 1/2 - 6 years  
of age), Monday through Friday, 6 a.m. - 6          
p.m., with cooking at 8501-03 Park Lane.            
WARD 2 #AO491446-11 ZONE: "A" -                     
Single Family Dwelling District                     
     APPEAL #9846 - Appeal filed by                 
Lindenwood Pre-owned Motors, from the               
determination of the Building Commissioner          
in the denial of an occupancy permit                
authorizing the Appellant to operate a pre-         
owned auto and accessories sales business (no       
repair) at 7090 Lansdowne Ave. WARD 23              
#AO490745-11 ZONE: "A" - Single                     
Family Dwelling District                            
      APPEAL #9847 - Appeal filed by D &            
M Car Detailing LLC, from the determination         
of the Building Commissioner in the denial of       
an occupancy permit authorizing the                 
Appellant to operate a car wash and detailing       
business at 5158-60 Dr. Martin Luther King          
Dr. WARD 26 #AO492208-11 ZONE:                      
"G" - Local Commercial & Office District            
     APPEAL #9848 - Appeal filed by EGE             
Auto Sales LLC, from the determination of           
the Building Commissioner in the denial of an       
occupancy permit authorizing the Appellant          
to operate a used auto sales/leasing and            
limousine rental business at 8323 Walter.           
WARD 2 #AO491827-11 ZONE: "F" -                     
Neighborhood Commercial District                    
     APPEAL #9849 - Appeal filed by                 
Metal Impressions LLC, from the                     
determination of the Building Commissioner          
in the denial of an occupancy permit                
authorizing the Appellant to operate an office/     
design and metal fabrication business at 6274       
Gravois. WARD 13 #AO492204-11 ZONE:                 
"F" - Neighborhood Commercial District              
      APPEAL #9850 - Appeal filed by                
Daughters of Charity, from the determination        
of the Building Commissioner in the denial of       
a building permit authorizing the Appellant         
to complete interior and exterior alterations,      
per plans, for a convent at 1348 -54 Tamm.          
WARD 24 #AB490174-11 ZONE: "A" -                    
Single Family Dwelling District                     
     In accordance with the provisions of           
ordinance 59981, effective July 31, 1986.           
     By authority of the Board of                 
 Adjustment.                                      
      S. Cunningham, Chairman

    REQUEST FOR                                  
     PROPOSALS                                   
    CITY OF ST. LOUIS                            
PARKS, RECREATION & FORESTRY                     
     The City of St. Louis is seeking qualified  
bids to submit Proposals for the Debt            
Collection Services for the Forestry and Water   
Divisions of the City.                           
     Bid documents may be obtained at the        
Parks, Recreation and Forestry Administration    
Building, 5600 Clayton Road in Forest Park,      
St. Louis, Missouri 63110, or the Forestry       
Division at 1415 North 14th Street, St. Louis,   
Missouri 63106, or downloaded from the           
City's website at http://stlouis-mo.gov/         
government.                                      
     Sealed bids will be received until 4:00     
P.M., Central Standard Time, on October 7,       
2011, at the Forestry Division.                  
     The City of St. Louis is an Equal           
Opportunity Employer, and Bidders shall          
comply with Mayor's Executive Order #28,         
as amended.                                      
     The City of St. Louis reserves the right    
to accept or reject any or all responses or to   
cancel this bid in part or in its entirety.      
INVITATION TO BID                                
 Board of Police Commissioners                   
 Metropolitan Police Department                  
    City of St. Louis, Missouri                  
             210-11-0020 -                       
    Vehicle Surveillance Equipment               
      Sealed bids of the above will be received  
at the St. Louis Metropolitan Police             
Department, Office of the Director of            
Purchasing, 1200 Clark Avenue, Room 605,         
St. Louis, Missouri 63103, until 11:00 a.m.      
local time, Friday, October 7, 2011 will be      
opened publicly and announced. Official bid      
forms on which bids must be submitted may        
be obtained from the Office of the Director of   
Purchasing by prospective bidders upon           
request in person or by telephone during         
regular business hours.                          
      Contractor shall not discriminate in       
matters of employment, upgrading, transfer,      
rates of pay selection or otherwise, against     
any employee or applicant for employment         
because of race, creed, color, sex or national   
origin. Noncompliance shall be sufficient        
cause to reject any bid or terminate the         
contract, and the Board of Police                
Commissioners of the St. Louis Metropolitan      
 Police Department shall be entitled to recover     
 any damages resulting from termination.            
       The Board of Police Commissioners            
 reserves the right to waive any formalities and    
 to reject any and all bids. The Board also         
 reserves the right to consider criteria other      
 than the low bid in the award of a contract.       
 Among other factors, the Board will consider       
 the location of the business, minority interest    
 in the business, prior performance and the bid     
 submitted in relation to the needs of the St.      
 Louis Metropolitan Police Department.              
       Bidders are hereby advised that the St.      
 Louis Living Wage Ordinance #65597 and             
 associated Regulations could apply to the          
 service for which bids are being sought herein.    
 This Ordinance requires that, unless specific      
 exemptions apply, all individuals who perform      
 work pursuant to a contract executed between       
 the successful bidder and the City must be         
 paid a minimum of the applicable Living Wage       
 rates and if rates are adjusted during the term    
 of the contract pursuant to the Ordinance,         
 applicable rates after such adjustment is made.    
 Each bidder must submit the "Living Wage           
 Acknowledgment and Acceptance Declaration          
 with the bid. Failure to submit this Declaration   
 with the bid will result in rejection of the bid.  
 A successful bidder's failure to comply with       
 the contract provisions related to the Living      
 Wage Ordinance may result in termination of        
 the contract and the imposition of additional      
 penalties as set for in the Ordinance and          
 Regulations.                                       
       Copies of the Ordinance and Regulations      
 are available upon request from Carol Shepard,     
 at 314-444-5608 or can be accessed at              
 http://www.stlouiscity.com/livingwage.             
      Bidders are also advised that the State       
 of Missouri requires workers on all public         
 works projects to be paid prevailing wages.        
 The contractor will forfeit a penalty to the       
 contracting public body of $100 per day (or        
 portion of a day) if a worker is paid less than    
 the prevailing rate for any work done under        
 the contract by the contractor or by any           
 subcontractor (Section 290.250, RSMo.).            
 Also, if a vendor would like to receive a bid      
 please email a request to bnturner@slmpd.org.      
 Email must include vendor's company                
 name, address, and description of bid.             
      Purchasing Division                           
      PHONE# 314-444-5608                           
 DEPARTMENT OF                                    
  PERSONNEL                                       
     NOTICE OF EXAMINATIONS                       
      The City of St. Louis, Department of        
 Personnel, 1114 Market Street, Room 700,         
 announces competitive Civil Service              
 examinations to fill vacancies in the Municipal  
 Service.                                         
       The last date for filing an application for
 the following examination is OCTOBER 7,          
 2011.                                            
           SECURITY OFFICER                       
             Prom./O.C. 1827                      
 $27,924 to $41,418 (Annual Salary Range)         
      Applications for the following              
 examinations will be accepted until a sufficient 
 number are received to fill anticipated          
 vacancies. Please submit application as soon     
 as possible.                                     
             HVAC MECHANIC                        
            Prom./O.C.C. 1828                     
 $36,478 to $57,902 (Annual Salary Range)         
           LEGAL SECRETARY                        
            Prom./O.C.C. 1826                     
 $33,020 to $49,010 (Annual Salary Range)         
       Vacations, Holidays, Sick Leave, Social    
 Security, and Employee Retirement System         
 Benefits privileges are provided in addition to  
 salary.                                          
       Application forms and further              
 information concerning duties of positions,      
 desirable and necessary qualifications, relative 
 weights of examination components, and           
 duration of eligible lists may be secured at the 
 office of the Department of Personnel, 1114      
 Market Street, Room 700, St. Louis MO            
 63101. Applications can be submitted on the      
 Internet. Visit the city web site at             
 www.stlouiscity.com and link to Jobs with        
 the City.                                        
                  Richard R. Frank,               
                  Director                        
 September 21, 2011                               
 NOTICE TO ALL BIDDERS                            
      CITY ORDINANCE requires that any            
 individual or company who performs work          
 within the City limits must obtain a Business    
 License. This would also apply to businesses     
 who employ sales or delivery personnel to        
 come into the City. Contracts requiring work     
 to be performed in the City will NOT be          
awarded to unlicensed businesses.                
ST. LOUIS LIVING                                 
WAGE ORDINANCE                                   
  LIVING WAGE REQUIREMENTS                       
Bidders [Proponents] are hereby advised that     
the St. Louis Living Wage Ordinance #65597       
and associated Regulations apply to the          
service [concession] [lease] [City Financial     
Assistance] for which [bids] [proposals] are     
being sought herein. This Ordinance requires     
that, unless specific exemptions apply, all      
individuals who perform work pursuant to a       
contract executed between the successful         
[bidder] [proponent] and the City [Agency]       
must be paid a minimum of the applicable         
Living Wage rates set forth in the attached      
Living Wage Bulletin, and, if the rates are      
adjusted during the term of the contract         
pursuant to the Ordinance, applicable rates      
after such adjustment is made. Each bidder       
[proponent] must submit the attached "Living     
Wage Acknowledgment and Acceptance               
Declaration" with the bid [proposal]. Failure    
to submit this Declaration with the bid          
[proposal] will result in rejection of the bid   
[proposal]. A successful bidder 's               
[proponent's] failure to comply with contract    
provisions related to the Living Wage            
Ordinance may result in termination of the       
contract and the imposition of additional        
penalties as set forth in the Ordinance and      
Regulations.                                     
     Copies of the Ordinance and Regulations     
are available upon request from La Queta         
Russell-Taylor, at (314) 426-8185, or can be     
accessed at http://www.mwdbe.org/living          
wage.

      Notice to All Suppliers                     
       It is the policy of the City of St. Louis  
 that all firms desiring to do business with the  
 City of St. Louis must comply with            
 employment practices that are in accordance   
 with the ordinances of the City of St. Louis  
 and the Mayor's Executive Order promulgated   
 there-under to the end that all Contractors   
 and suppliers of materials and services will  
 offer equal opportunity for employment and    
 job advancement to blacks and other minority  
 groups in the St. Louis Metropolitan area.    
             Obtaining Bids                    
           To download bids log on to:         
  http://stlouis-mo.gov/supply/bid-notices.cfm 
 then, search available bids.                  
     You may also contact the Supply           
 Commissioner's office at (314) 622-4580 or    
 e-mail supplydivisionbidrequests.com          
       Bidders are invited to be present at the
 opening of bids. Bid results may be available 
 30 days following the date of bid opening.    
 If you desire bid results, please include a   
 self-address, stamped envelope with your bid. 
           Recycled Products                   
      The City of St. Louis desires to         
 purchase recycled products whenever           
 possible, especially items containing post    
 consumer waste materials. If your company     
 can supply recycled products, please provide  
 information to this office.                   
            Surplus Property                   
      Notice is hereby given that the City of  
 St. Louis may have surplus property for sale  
 during the course of the year. The property   
 may be listed at www.govdeals.com or in the   
 City Journal.                                 
      The right to reject any and all bids is  
 reserved.                                     
                 Freddie L. Dunlap             
                 Supply Commissioner           
                 (314) 622-4580                
                 www.stlouis-mo.gov
